holidays.name: Ditch New Year’s Resolutions Day
holidays.description: The day to throw in the towel on those ambitious New Year’s goals! If you’ve already abandoned your resolutions, you’re not alone – today is the official day to embrace the slip-ups.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday emerged from the common mid-January slump where many realize sticking to resolutions is tougher than expected.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that nearly 80% of New Year’s resolutions fail by the second week of February, so this day just gets ahead of the curve!

holidays.name: Bean Day
holidays.description: A celebration of all things beans — from baked beans to bean burritos, this day honors the versatile pulse that’s been a staple food worldwide for thousands of years.
holidays.origin: Established in 1970 by USA Dry Bean Council to promote the nutritional benefits of beans.
holidays.funFact: Beans are one of the oldest cultivated plants and were one of the main protein sources for ancient civilizations!

holidays.name: Ditch Your New Year's Resolution Day
holidays.description: Another nod to quitting those tough resolutions, this day humorously endorses ditching commitments you no longer feel like keeping.
holidays.origin: Popularized on social media as a way to poke fun at the difficulty of sticking to resolutions.
holidays.funFact: ‘Ditch New Year’s Resolutions Day’ is celebrated especially by gym memberships dropping sharply after January.

holidays.name: Kid Inventors’ Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the creative minds of young inventors around the world who come up with inventions that can change the future!
holidays.origin: Chosen to honor Benjamin Franklin’s birthday, a prolific inventor himself, and inspire young innovators.
holidays.funFact: Some famous inventors who started young include Louis Braille, who invented Braille at age 15, and Philo Farnsworth, who conceived the first fully functional all-electronic TV at just 14!
